static EntityPicker & instance ()

Detailed Description

EntityPicker.

picks entities from a list, based on ( in order ):

  • capabilities
  • distance
  • field of view
  • line of sight

float EntityPicker::autoAimAdhesionDistance (  )  const

This method returns the auto aim distance.

void EntityPicker::autoAimAdhesionDistance ( float  distance  ) 

This method sets the auto aim distance.

Entities need to be within this distance to be considered for auto aim.

Parameters:
distance The distance in metres.

This method sets the minimum distance for full auto aim friction.

Short of this distance, the auto aim friction falls off to zero at zero.

void EntityPicker::check ( float *  pDeltaTime = NULL  ) 

This method checks that the current entity is still valid.

Parameters:
pDeltaTime If non-NULL, a pointer to float containing the time since the last update. This is used to calculate the heldTime_.

float EntityPicker::deselectionFoV (  )  const

This method returns the deselectable field of view.

void EntityPicker::deselectionFoV ( float  angleRadians  ) 

This method sets the deselection field of view.

This is the angle, in radians, from the bottom of the deselection volume to the top. Since the aspect ratio is 1, this is also the angle from the left to the right. Once a selected object leaves this volume, it is deselected.

Parameters:
angleRadians The field of view angle in radians.

)

This method decides if there's a target in the friction FOV.

void EntityPicker::isEnabled ( bool  value  )  [inline]

bool EntityPicker::isEnabled (  )  const [inline]

bool EntityPicker::isFull (  )  const [inline]

void EntityPicker::isHeld ( bool  b  ) 

This method sets whether or not the picker should attempt to hold the current target.

While this value is true, no new target is picked and the current target is kept while it is within the deselection frustrum and the target is not hidden for too long.

bool EntityPicker::isHeld (  )  const

This method returns whether or not the picker should attempt to hold the current target.

While this value is true, no new target is picked and the current target is kept while it is within the deselection frustrum and the target is not hidden for too long.

bool EntityPicker::isHidden (  )  const [inline]

This method targets the input entity.

void EntityPicker::noPartialLocks ( bool  enable  )  [inline]

Entity * EntityPicker::pGeneralTarget (  )  const

This method return the current target.

It may not be a full target but just the thing that a reticle is drawn around.

Entity * EntityPicker::pTarget (  )  const

This method returns the current target.

If the current entity is not a full target, NULL is returned.

float EntityPicker::selectionFoV (  )  const

This method returns the selectable field of view.

void EntityPicker::selectionFoV ( float  angleRadians  ) 

This method sets the selectable field of view.

This is the angle, in radians, from the bottom of the selection volume to the top. Since the aspect ratio is 1, this is also the angle from the left to the right.

Parameters:
angleRadians The field of view angle in radians.

const Capabilities &  capsOff 
)

This method changes the capabilities that the entity picker looks for.

bool EntityPicker::skeletonCheck ( const Entity &  entity,
const Matrix &  lookFrom 
) const

This method returns true if the skeleton could be targetted.

It also returns true if the entity does not have a skeleton collider.
